newsitem.title: USA: Consolidated Graphics to buy Geyer Printing.
newsitem.headline: Consolidated Graphics to buy Geyer Printing.

text.p: Geyer Printing Co Inc, a privately held company, said Monday it has signed a letter of intent to be acquired by Consolidated Graphics Inc in a stock-for-stock merger deal.
Geyer, which is in the commercial printing business, will retain its name and management, it said in a news release.
Other terms of the transaction were not disclosed.
Geyer said it and Houston-based Consolidated Graphics expect to complete the transaction by the end of August.
Upon completion of the deal, Consolidated Graphics will have 24 companies in 19 markets with annualized revenue of more than $225 million, according to the news release.
